keyTakeAways: Colombians are expressing widespread anxiety over the escalating diplomatic feud between US President Donald Trump and Colombian President Gustavo Petro, fearing economic and social consequences.

Trump has threatened to cut subsidies and raise tariffs on Colombia, accusing Petro of encouraging drug production, which could severely impact Colombia’s economy, especially given the US is Colombia’s largest trading partner (30% of exports).
Colombia’s key exports — oil, coffee, flowers, gold, fruits, and manufactured goods — would become more expensive under higher tariffs, potentially leading to job losses and company bankruptcies.
Petro previously criticized US actions against drug-smuggling boats in the Caribbean and called for criminal proceedings, leading to a US visa revocation, deepening diplomatic tensions.
The US provides about $450 million annually in military and economic aid to Colombia for anti-drug efforts; a potential cut would severely weaken Colombia’s capacity to fight drug trafficking.
Colombian citizens, including taxi drivers, housewives, university students, and retirees, express concern about economic damage, visa access, and respect for national sovereignty.
The feud underscores a broader issue where both leaders have made inflammatory remarks, failing to consider the real-world impact on ordinary citizens.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Colombians are deeply concerned as a diplomatic feud escalates between US President Donald Trump and Colombian President Gustavo Petro. Trump has accused Petro of being a drug trafficker and threatened to cut US subsidies and raise tariffs, which could severely impact Colombia’s economy—its largest trading partner accounting for 30% of exports. The threat would disrupt key industries such as coffee, oil, flowers, and gold, leading to job losses and business failures. Petro has previously challenged US actions against drug-smuggling boats, leading to a visa revocation and ongoing tensions. Citizens from various backgrounds express fear over economic and personal consequences, including visa access and national dignity. The conflict underscores a failure of both leaders to engage constructively, with ordinary people bearing the brunt of escalating political rhetoric and policy threats.
title: Colombians Caught in Fallout of Trump-Petro Feud
